Reviews.Title: “Confortable, clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: tree1990
Reviews.Content: Booked over octopus travel and found a bargain with breakfast included. Very clean and comfortable room and even though hotel was full nice and quiet. Room was serviced daily and all staff were very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast was your standard German selection, cold meats, cereal, eggs, etc. all very nice however head down to breakfast early as with every hotel every body wants to eat at the last minute Five minute walk from tube station and lots of local attractions nearby. Loved Berlin and will be staying here again on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here before...”
Reviews.Author: Laweier
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel before because the value and the location for the relatives I visiting. Sad that the wifi was not working in the rooms...I hope it will be better for my next stay. The receptionists could smile a bit more...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, tacky location”
Reviews.Author: Tina K
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as our base for the weekend celebration of our anniversary in Berlin. The main reason we chose it was a good price and a location close to tube station. The hotel itself is nice, even though some small repairs should have been done, but overall was staying there a nice experience. The staff was pleasant and the service of the hotel bar good. The only problem I find is the location - the Grand City name couldn't be more inapropriate as it is situated in a very tacky neigbourhood. There were a few homeless people on our way to a hotel and once you enter, you feel in a completely different world, but then there is the walk from hotel to tube again and... well thank god I was with my boyfriend because I would have been very scared to walk around that area alone in the dark. If that's not an issue for you, however, pick this hotel and enjoy the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, minimal service”
Reviews.Author: Lancino
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in dec 2011. A bit further away from central but was easy to get around by train. The hotel is much nicer than the area that it is in. Rooms are larger than other hotel rooms we've come across in Germany. When we first got there, we opened the bathroom bin and there was rubbish in there from the previous guest. The second day we went out and left a "do not disturb" sign on the door. This was ignored and housekeeping came and made up the room anyway. I advised reception who apologised and said they would follow it up for me. All went well until the second last day we were there. We put the "do not disturb" sign on the door as we had done previously and it was ignored by housekeeping again. We had also left a bottle of wine in the room next to a used glass and housekeeping filled the glass with some of the wine. No idea why. I called reception and explained that housekeeping had come in again and the response I got was "ok..." followed by 5 seconds of silence. I asked why this had happened again, told them it was a privacy breach and said I had private things in the room. I finally got an apology and was told that they would follow up with the duty manager. I don't appreciate the fact that the staff did not respect our privacy and they didn't seem particularly worried when housekeeping disobeyed the sign. I want to leave a hotel during the day knowing my belongings are safe and this hotel did not make me feel this way. Fir this reason, I will not be staying at a best western hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Laweier
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good deals on the net. I Stayed in November and I'm going back un January and February.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it to yourself”
Reviews.Author: xxSophiaxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in September 2011 for 4 nights.The hotel is not in the centre of the city and a 20 minute walk from the wrong metro station, a 10 minute walk from the right one and a couple of tram stops away from the train station - which is probably ok if you're not single and you got a bit of a hefty suitcase to carry because you're on an 11 day Berlin-Paris trip. This hotel believes in the concept of 'you don't ask - you don't get'. Which is ok, but when you ask for a tray with tea / coffee and a kettle, it would be great if the dirty cups were taken out of the room during service the next morning. It's one of those weird hotels where the 3rd floor is on the 3rd floor of the lift and then you have to walk down a flight of narrow stairs - remember the don't ask don't get thing? - well, there are no offers to help you carry your bag to your room, either. I am not a princess (although I am partial to being a drama queen from time to time) and I do like a firm bed - I actually left the hotel with a backache, and I wrote a letter to the Manager while I was there - I asked and I didn't get, so I guess it makes no difference either way. Service with a smile, even just a little one? No. Nope - not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,good hotel”
Reviews.Author: L A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 for five days. Very clean and located in a walking distance from bus and metro stations and from the city centre itself. Rooms were small but it didn't matter as we came to see Berlin, not the inside of the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Verey good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: mabCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay in this hotel and I will be comming back.The room and bathroom is spacious and very clean. Staff is very friendly, and when you learn about the 2 tramlines outside the hotel ( 4 min. walk ) which take you to Bornholmer str. or Osloer str. stations in 7 min. then there is acces to Whole Berlin. The breakfast is at bit expensive, but just round the corner there are coffeshops with a very good and cheap breakfast - and then you can pick up your own time for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, only 15 mins walk”
Reviews.Author: TravelledCumbrian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet street on the part of Albrechtstasse to north of Reinhardtstrasse and only about 15 minutes walk to the Hauptbahnhof, Unter den Linden, Museum Island and the bars/restaurants of Hackerschen Markt (also recommended.) The rooms were clean, good facilities - TV, air-con, desk, safe; though overall a bit on the small side for two if staying more than a few days. Wifi had a strong signal. Our rooms seemed to have new fittings - on Google Satellite view it is still a building site so assume it is all new (can see it on Streetview though.) Breakfast was decent and well worth filling-up on for €8 as Berlin can get pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel with less than helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in residential area, around 5 minutes walk from either s-bahn or u-bahn (there is a tram stop closer). I did not find the location to be an issue but for people on vacation here it may be not be the perfect location as there are not really any good restaurants or such around either. The hotel feels like it is in dire need of renovation. The reception area is fairly ok but once getting up to the rooms it is apparent that it has not been renovated in many years. I was also a bit surprised of the lack of a/c in the room. Berlin in August is rather warm so would have been good to have a/c. The room was otherwise ok, had a decent bed and was clean. The bathroom was also as expected. There was a desk to work at and it would have been useful if the wifi had worked. The main issue I had was however with the wifi. It was of course not working at all and the staff were entirely uninterested helping me.The attitude was appalling and they could not even bother to suggest a place in the area which offered wifi. They made not attempts to fix anything but simple stated that they could not really do anything. When I explained that I had specifically asked if there was wifi when I booked since I needed to work they merely restated that they could not really do anything but that I could perhaps wait a day or so to see if it would work then (which is an interesting statement since I just checked in and the person knew I was checking out the next day). There are so many better hotels in the same price range in Berlin so will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite location”
Reviews.Author: SpachNZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a quite street and can be easily accessed by public transport from Tegel airport (take the TXL bus to Karlplatz) or the Hauptbahnhof. There are a few good restaurants within a few minutes walk (at the end of Albrechtstrasse there is a very nice Italian restaurant). There is public transport near by, so access to the main sites is easy. The Brandenburger Tor and Bundestag are about a 10-15 minute walk away. The hotel was clean, the room was on the small side, but adequate for two people with one medium case. If we had of had two cases this would have been a problem as there is not really anywhere to put a second case. The breakfast selection was good (cost €8 per person). However, the breakfast room had too few staff and replacement of the cooked breakfast food was slow and also the making up of new tables slow. There is free WiFi throughout the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mitte is Not Downtown”
Reviews.Author: mandelstam
Reviews.Content: Rooms OK, Breakfasts great [full buffet], but location is way out of downtown in primarily residential area. Not near restaurants, night life etc. Must walk or take tram/bus to U-bahn If you didn't bring your own laptop, there is only one shared computer for all guests in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASK22
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be out of the town centre but it is only five stops away from Friedrichstrasse in the city centre (took about ten minutes) by S-Bahn. It's about a five minute walk from the hotel to Bornholmer Strasse S-Bahn station, or you can take the tram two stops if you so wish. The hotel is in a fairly quiet neighbourhood. It's mainly residential so there wasn't much noise at night. That be said, there's not much in the line of activities either. However, Prenzlauer Berg is quite close, ideal for eating, shopping and nightlife, and you can get a tram back afterwards. The room was spacious and cleaned daily, as expected. Staff friendly, happy to talk in English if required.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Facilities,but not in Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1635509
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a city break to Berlin. Hotel excellent ,staff helpful and friendly food very good, Rooms clean and comfortable.Would have liked tea and coffee in our room. We were given a kettle on request but no cups or tea and coffee to put in them. My only complaint is that the hotel is supposed to be in Mitte(centre of Berlin) but it is no where near the centre.It is a good 10 minute walk to the underground and a further 15 minutes into the centre of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeginS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel for 2 nights. I think this hotel is really good to stay. The staffs were friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean. We enjoyed staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RUBBISH location”
Reviews.Author: Jayestar
Reviews.Content: This hotel has "Mitte" in its title... It's an absolute lie! It's nowhere near the Mitte area. It takes a good half hour plus a 15 minute walk from the S-Bahn, so once you're out for the day, you have to stay out i..e. no popping pack to freshen up. The room was dowdy, with the bed oddly placed and the mini-bar had been removed, so there was a smelly old disused fridge under the tv. The church bells next door ring for 15 minutes every morning at 8am; not good after a night out in Berlin. £15 was asked for breakfast - we didn't bother, and just spent as much time in the city as possible. Love Berlin, won't be back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fiendly and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: notenoughtravelling
Reviews.Content: Good value, clean rooms, friendly and helpfull staff. Not in the centre of Berlin but about 10 minutes away by S/U Bhan. Taxi return from city centre never cost more than €10 and only a short distance away. Only downside was the Breakfast costing €18 so would advise on holding out and grabbing a bite elsewhere and the church bells at 9am sound like they are next door.

Reviews.Title: “misleading location”
Reviews.Author: GbTubs
Reviews.Content: This hotel, whilest being perfectly acceptable and very good value for money in relation to the standard of the qooms, is not what anyone would consider to be in 'Mitte'. It is quite far from the centre of Berlin and although the underground is easy to use, the hotel is situated quite some distance from the nearest station and the area surrounding the hotel is not ideal, to say the least. The hotel itself was a pleasant suprise. No problems with the rooms which were clean and comfortable, but the bar shuts at whatever time the staff decide; irrespective of the time displayed and no amount of cajoling the (still in attendance) barman or the front of house staff could persuade them to serve us drinks even though we had arrived before the advertised closing time. This happened on several occasions during our stay and all the consierge said was 'would you like to complain'?! There is a bank of vending machines which serve snacks and extortionately priced drinks (can, bottles etc) but room service ends early so late travellers will be disappointed. All in all, if you are looking for a hotel with very reasonable rates for good rooms, basic service and you do not mind being quite remote from the centre of Berlin, this hotel will serve you well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location but slightly cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: sadamson117uk
Reviews.Content: Nice location (just North of Unter den Linden) and easy walk to most tourist attractions. There were some reasonable bars/resturants within a couple of minutes walk. Perfectly safe area. Not much space in the room apart from the bed. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, upbeat and good value”
Reviews.Author: mccdzyne
Reviews.Content: Spent couple nights as a package deal here - U2 rock concert at Olympiastadium- found hotel reasonably located - pleasant and helpful staff. The rooms are what one expect of this class to be - with nice miniamilist , trendy touch. Would stay again and recommend, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty poor, especially location”
Reviews.Author: ivan_benjamin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located much too far from the centre of the city for tourist who want to spend their time visiting the main sites and to see a little bit of life in the evening. I.t is in a not too inviting area where yoy cannot stroll out and sit at a nice boulevard cafe , have a drink and watch the crowds passing by. After a tiring day in the city it is a bit much having to walk 10/15 minutes back to the hotel from the underground station.There is no air conditioning in the bedrooms and when we were there it was absolutely stifling. the hotel had decided to take the minibars out of use. For a 4* (so called) you would expect to have a few 'goodies' in the bathroom and indeed not all bathrooms had a bath just a shower (though to give it credit that the half bathroom with our room was new and very nice). the food was reasonable, no great shakes and thre was only one waiter serving quite a full dining room at breakfast. Overall the hotel was pretty bland and quite unatractive.

Reviews.Title: “OK FOR A NIGHT OR TWO BUT LOCATION?”
Reviews.Author: kawasaki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in June whilst on a 3 city break with Great Rail Journeys. In my view and that of most of the others on the holiday this hotel is not in the best location to get into the centre of the City.Its a decent walk to the tube a bit shorter for a tram.The hotel did not live up to expectations, food was at best average,they seemed short on staff at times and hotel reception standard was variable. Its in a bit of a shabby area and some of our travelling companions who were mainly over 65 didnt feel that safe at night in the area and one was apporached right outside the hotel lobby by some very unsavoury individuals. I have to say many of us wondered why our tour company had booked us into this hotel in the first place due to the location the hotel is at very best a 3 star affair nothing more so dissapointing all round..

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress....”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver778
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in the newly opened Capital hotel and was happy with the overall service. The hotel is far from being finished and there are several signs that the work will be ongoing for some time (for example, the wireless internet is not currently available in the rooms at the time of writing though is available in the bar/lobby). The hotel staff are very professional and courteous and the catering standard is generally high. Overall the hotel is a generic business hotel. It would be suitable for leisure trips provided you had some reason to be in this area of Berlin. The location is far from being central and, while there are some shops and restaurants close by, it is not located in one of the nicer districts of Berlin. The nearest metro stop to the centre is about 500 meters from the hotel (A taxi costs about 12 euro to the centre). The hotel itself is sheltered from the main street and is very quiet (with the exception of church bells at 8 o clock every morning which are impossible to sleep through!) Rooms are decorated to a high standard, though the lack of tea or coffee making facilities are sorely lacking. There is a good selection of TV stations for the German speaker and only CNN is in english.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Grand City Hotel Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Osloer Strasse 116a, 13359 Berlin, Germany
